english: what (in compounds); which; assorted; file (troop unit)

etymology.interpretation: Built with the person component to signal a human or group context, while 十 supplies the sound (shí/shén). The ten element also echoes the classical sense of a file of ten soldiers, with later usage appearing mainly in compounds like 什么.

examples.chinese: 你在做什么工作(你在做什麼工作)。
他买了些什物放在仓库里(他買了些什物放在倉庫裡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎi le xiē shíwù fàng zài cāngkù lǐ.
examples.english: He bought some sundries and put them in the warehouse.

examples.chinese: 这道菜是什锦炒饭(這道菜是什錦炒飯)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài shì shíjǐn chǎofàn.
examples.english: This dish is assorted fried rice.
